an11.10:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, at the monastery of the wanderers in the peacocks’ feeding ground.
an11.10:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
an11.10:5.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:5.3: The entire spectrum of a master’s ethics, samādhi, and wisdom.
an11.10:5.4: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:6.1: A mendicant who has another three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:6.3: A demonstration of psychic power, a demonstration of revealing, and an instructional demonstration.
an11.10:6.4: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:7.1: A mendicant who has another three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:7.3: Right view, right knowledge, and right freedom.
an11.10:7.4: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:8.1: A mendicant who has two qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:8.4: A mendicant with these two qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:8.5: Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra also spoke this verse:
an11.10:9.1: ‘The aristocrat is best of those people
an11.10:9.2: who take clan as the standard.
an11.10:9.3: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
an11.10:9.4: is best of gods and humans.’
an11.10:10.1: Now, that verse spoken by Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra is well spoken, not poorly spoken.
an11.10:11.1: ‘The aristocrat is best of those people
an11.10:11.2: who take clan as the standard.
an11.10:11.3: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
an11.10:11.4: Is best of gods and humans.’”
